title: Watch Miyamoto take a tour of Super Nintendo World's new Donkey Kong Country theme park expansion
description: After a six month delay, Universal Studios Japan's Donkey Kong Country themed Super Nintendo World expansion finally has an opening date. It'll be barrel-blasting open its doors from 11th December, and if you're curious to see what's in store, you can now watch Nintendo's Shigeru Miyamoto take a tour of the area, with a brief pause to bonk on some bongo drums. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Lego Star Wars Advent Calendar Restocked At Amazon, Only $29 (Will Sell Out)
description: Lego Star Wars 2024 Advent Calendar $29 (was $45) with coupon | 246 pieces See at Amazon See at Target Lego Marvel Spider-Man 2024 Advent Calendar $36 (was $45) | 246 pieces See at Amazon See at Target Lego Disney 2024 Advent Calendar $36 (was $45) | 253 pieces See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Target Lego Harry Potter 2024 Advent Calendar $36 (was $45) | 301 pieces See at Walmart Sold out at Amazon If you're looking for a fun Advent Calendar ahead of the holidays, Lego's 2024 lineup of calendars themed around Star Wars, Spider-Man, Disney, and Harry Potter are still available (for now). Retailers are sold out of the Lego City version, and the calendars based on popular entertainment franchises have been going in and out of stock.If you're interested the Star Wars edition, now's the time to buy it. Amazon just restocked the 2024 Star Wars Lego Advent Calendar and is offering a limited-time discount that drops the price to only $29. It normally costs $45, but if you click the coupon box on the store page or in your cart, you'll get it for its lowest price yet. Amazon is matching Target's early Black Friday deal, and we'd expect both retailers to sell out soon.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Scott Pilgrim Hardcover Graphic Novel Box Set Is Over $100 Off At Amazon
description: Scott Pilgrim 20th Anniversary Box Set (Color) $143.68 (was $250) See at Amazon Scott Pilgrim 20th Anniversary Box Set (B&W) $136.55 (was $250) See at Amazon Scott Pilgrim Print Collection 2004-2024 $28 (was $30) See at Amazon Scott Pilgrim's 20th Anniversary Hardcover Box Sets released in August, but if you didn't pick one of them up then, you should check out Amazon's current deals on both sets. For this special anniversary release, Bryan Lee O'Malley's beloved graphic novel series received an exclusive, full-color makeover. The full-color edition of Scott Pilgrim is discounted to $143.68 (was $250). For the purists, there's also a remastered black-and-white collection, and that one is slightly cheaper at $136.53 (was $250).Scott Pilgrim: 20th Anniversary Color Hardcover Box Set (6 Volumes) -- $143.68 ($250)Scott Pilgrim: 20th Anniversary Remastered B&W Hardcover Box Set (6 Volumes) -- $136.53 ($250)Scott Pilgrim Precious Little Slipcase Paperback Collection (6 Volumes) -- $56 ($90)Scott Pilgrim Print Collection 2004-2024 -- $28 ($30)Here's what you get with the new hardcover box sets:Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Valve Reveals Very Pretty, All-White Steam Deck
description: Valve has announced a new white and gray variant of its uber-popular portable PC device, the Steam Deck. This upcoming version of the handheld PC will cost $680 and will go on sale on November 18. Read more...
author: Zack Zwiezen

title: The Devs Behind Awesome Half-Life Remake Are Making A New Game
description: Remember Black Mesa, that really good fan-made remake of the original Half-Life built using the Half-Life 2 engine? Well, some of the devs behind that project are making something completely new and unrelated to Half-Life. It’s called Rogue Point and it’s a tactical co-op shooter with roguelite elements. Read more...

title: D&D’s new map tool enters public beta, but it’s probably not the one you were expecting
description: Wizards of the Coast announced its new virtual tabletop, Maps, is entering public beta after a year of alpha testing. This new phase of Maps takes all of the virtual tabletop’s original features — which includes rolling digital dice, character tokens, and integration of maps and monsters from a user’s D&D Beyond library — and […]

author: Ford James

title: The next limited-edition Steam Deck OLED comes in white, and will be available globally this time
description: The Steam Deck OLED – which is like a Steam Deck but better in almost every way – is getting a new, if potentially more smudge-susceptible Limited Edition. A successor to the translucent version that only went on sale in the US and Canada last year, the Steam Deck OLED: Limited Edition White offers both a snowy look and, for those of us outside North America, the chance to actually buy one. It’ll go on sale November 18th, in all the countries that the Steam Deck currently ships in. Read more
author: James Archer

title: How ten years of Game Maker’s Toolkit’s design analysis informed Mind Over Magnet
description: "A lot of puzzle games can leave you staring at the same static screen for ages, but here, I’m always pushing you forward," says Mark Brown of Game Maker’s Toolkit. For a decade now, Brown has been releasing accessible deep dives on game design for his popular YouTube channel, like "How Game Designers Protect Players From Themselves" and "The Two Types of Random in Game Design." This week, he’s releasing his own for the first time. Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 856
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1.Something you accomplished recently that makes you feel good? I helped Connor start a weekly chart to track her chores around the house, and we’ve been refining it over a few weeks to see what works and what doesn’t work. It took a while to figure it out, to be honest. I’m feeling good about it, and I think she is too; I’m hoping it sets her up with good habits for the future. 2. Last beauty product you bought? I grabbed a cream shadow from Charlotte Tilbury, the Eyes to Mesmerise Cream Shadow in Oyster Pearl, a shimmery bronze-gold, from the Sephora fall sale. 3. Pick your fun eyeliner color – green, purple or blue? Purple, please! 4. Walking outside in the rain – yes or no?[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 856 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 837
description: Novato police are on the lookout for a burglar who broke into the Novato Museum of Cat Antiquities last night. Detective Rosie was first on the scene. “Meow,” she said, when asked for a description of the burglar. The break in occurred shortly after 2:00 AM, and police were alerted when the burglar set off the museum’s security alarm. Police put out an APB and started a manhunt…although video surveillance suggests the suspect could be a canine. “Meow,” said Detective Rosie. If you or someone you know has information that leads to the arrest of the Novato Museum of Cat Antiquities burglar, Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC is offering a reward. Company founder and former Chief Feline Officer Tabs was a captain in the Canadian Cat Mounties before embarking upon his successful career as a kitty supermodel and entrepreneur, and the company continues to be a strong supporter of law enforcement. “Meow,” said Rosie again. Sooner or later, we’ll catch this criminal. Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 837 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
